A company has been using Dynamics 365 Business Central for many years.
A new accounting manager for the company reviews the chart of accounts. The manager wants to remove some general ledger accounts.
The Check G/L Account Usage field is selected in the General Ledger Setup.
You need to assist with the account deletions.
What is one requirement that enables deletion of a general ledger account?

choices.C: The general ledger account cannot allow for direct posting.
choices.D: The account must have ledger entries.
choices.A: The account cannot be used in any posting groups or posting setup
choices.B: The account cannot be used in any account schedule.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
By disabling Direct Posting, you can be sure that the receivable account will only be posted with the Customer Ledger Entries. You can be sure that they will be reconciled.
Totaling is only totaling the GL Account, eg. Total Receivables is the totaling for Receivable - Local and Receivable - Export.

Selected Answer: D
D. Disallow direct posting.

Disallowing direct posting to the accounts receivable general ledger account would ensure that all entries to this account come from the customer cards. This would help to maintain the integrity of the accounts receivable balance, as it would always match the sum of the balances on the customer cards.

questions.question_text:
The general ledger account for accounts receivable must match the sum of all balances on the customer cards.
You need to set up the general ledger account card for accounts receivable to meet this requirement.
What should you do?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Item Cross-References is the way to go

Selected Answer: C
The correct answer is:

C. Item cross-references

Explanation:

Item cross-references in Dynamics 365 Business Central allow you to set up vendor-specific item numbers and descriptions. This feature is useful when vendors use different item numbers or descriptions than those used in your company. When you create a purchase order or other document, you can use the vendor's item number, and Business Central will automatically recognize it as your internal item number. This helps to avoid confusion and ensures accuracy in your transactions with the vendor.
